title.value: Predicting histopathology markers of endometrial carcinoma with a quantitative image analysis approach based on spherical harmonics in multiparametric MRI
title.justification: The title clearly summarizes the main focus of the paper, which is predicting histopathology markers of endometrial carcinoma using a spherical harmonics-based quantitative image analysis approach in MRI.
title.quote: Predicting histopathology markers of endometrial carcinoma with a quantitative image analysis approach based on spherical harmonics in multiparametric MRI

extractions.description: This paper introduces a novel quantitative image analysis approach using spherical harmonics for predicting histopathological markers of endometrial carcinoma in multiparametric MRI. The study evaluates the performance of this approach in predicting deep myometrial invasion and high-grade tumor histology in comparison to radiomics analysis.

type.justification: The paper involves conducting experiments and comparisons between SPHARM analysis and radiomics to evaluate their predictive performance, which categorizes it as empirical research.
type.quote: The purpose of this study was to introduce the mathematical development of image descriptors computed from spherical harmonics (SPHARM) decompositions as well as the associated machine learning pipeline, and to evaluate their performance in predicting deep myometrial invasion (MI) and histopathological high-grade in preoperative multiparametric magnetic resonance imaging (MRI).

name.justification: The research focuses on image analysis techniques applied to MRI for diagnosing endometrial carcinoma.
name.quote: Purpose: Identifying optimal machine learning pipelines for computer-aided diagnosis is key for the development of robust, reproducible, and clinically relevant imaging biomarkers for endometrial carcinoma.

name.justification: The study develops and evaluates a machine learning pipeline based on SPHARM descriptors for diagnostic purposes.
name.quote: The purpose of this study was to introduce the mathematical development of image descriptors computed from spherical harmonics (SPHARM) decompositions as well as the associated machine learning pipeline.

name.justification: The paper compares the performance of SPHARM descriptors with radiomics analysis in predicting cancer characteristics.
name.quote: Because of all these design choices, our main hypothesis is that a machine learning pipeline based on SPHARM descriptors will perform better than a state-of-the-art radiomics pipeline for predicting histopathological outcomes in endometrial carcinoma on MRI.

name.justification: This model is used in the study to classify SPHARM descriptors for diagnostic purposes.
name.quote: Tensor-based logistic regression was used to classify two-dimensional SPHARM rotationally-invariant descriptors.

is_contributed.justification: The paper introduces the use of tensor-based logistic regression as a part of their novel pipeline.
is_contributed.quote: Tensor-based logistic regression was used to classify two-dimensional SPHARM rotationally-invariant descriptors.

is_executed.justification: The study executes experiments using the tensor-based logistic regression as part of their analysis.
is_executed.quote: The logistic regression model was trained on VOIs extracted from precise manual tumor segmentations.

is_compared.justification: The model's performance is compared with radiomics methods within the study.
is_compared.quote: The diagnostic performance of the SPHARM analysis was not significantly different (P = 0.62) from that of radiomics for predicting deep MI but was significantly higher (P = 0.044) for predicting high-grade histology.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not explicitly reference another paper for the tensor-based logistic regression as it is part of the methodology proposed within this research.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Tensor-based logistic regression was used to classify two-dimensional SPHARM rotationally-invariant descriptors.

name.value: MRI dataset of 128 women with endometrial carcinoma
name.justification: The dataset used in this study consists of MRI data from 128 women with confirmed endometrial carcinoma.
name.quote: Patients and methods: This retrospective study included 128 women with histopathology-confirmed endometrial carcinomas who underwent 1.5-T MRI before hysterectomy between January 2011 and July 2015.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset, being an integral part of this study, is not referenced from another paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Patients and methods: This retrospective study included 128 women with histopathology-confirmed endometrial carcinomas who underwent 1.5-T MRI before hysterectomy between January 2011 and July 2015.

name.justification: MATLAB was used for statistical analyses in the study.
name.quote: Statistical analyses were performed in MATLAB (v2020b, Math-Works).

referenced_paper_title.justification: MATLAB is mentioned as the software used for statistical analyses in this study and is not a reference from another paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Statistical analyses were performed in MATLAB (v2020b, Math-Works).
